page.title: 08FARMING, NE Sutton Coldfield
page.content: The central, northern, southern and eastern areas of the block are farmland, just over half of which is given over to crops other than grass, particularly oil seed rape and potatoes. The bright yellow oil seed blossom is especially picturesque in summer. There are also some horticultural crops. A quarter of the farmland is sown and fertilized grassland used for pasture or for cutting as grass, hay or silage. The remaining farmland i.e. approximately one eighth, is little fertilized grassland used for rough grazing. Farmers tend to keep some cattle and pigs.
